content: 24-48mos you will start on row 5 and continue finishing on row 21 follow instructions according to the size hat you are making 0-3mos 3-6mos 6-12mos 12-24mos 24-48mos 5-10yrs adult size adult row 1 k10 k2tog till end of round - 44 stitches remaining row 2 k till end of round size sizes 5-10yrs adult row 3 k9 k2tog till end of round - 40 stitches remaining row 4 k till end of round sizes 24-48mos 5-10yrs adult row 5 k8 k2tog till end of round - 36 stitches remaining row 6 k till end of round sizes 12-24mos 24-48mos 5-10yrs adult row 7 k7 k2tog till end of round - 32 stitches remaining row 8 k till end of round sizes 6-12mos 12-24mos 24-48mos 5-10yrs adult row 9 k6 k2tog till end of round - 28 stitches remaining row 10 k till end of round sizes 3-6mos 6-12mos 12-24mos 24-48mos 5-10yrs adult row 11 k5 k2tog till end of round - 24 stitches remaining row 12 k till end of round sizes 0-3mos 3-6mos 6-12mos 12-24mos 24-48mos 5-10yrs adult row 13 k4 k2tog till end of round - 20 stitches remaining row 14 k till end of round row 15 k3 k2tog til end of round - 16 stitches remaining row 16 k till end of round row 17 k2 k2tog till end of round - 12 stitches remaining row 18 k till end of round row 19 k1 k2tog till end of round - 8 stitches remaining row 20 k till end of round row 21 k2tog till end of round - 4 stitches remaining cut working yarn leaving an 18 tail thread tail through tapestry needle and sew through remaining stitches pull to tighten and close up hole knot and secure on inside of hat weave in any remaining loose ends on inside of hat proceed onto instructions on page 4 to make pom pom © creatiknit 2014 this pattern is the sole and express property of creatiknit this original pattern is for personal use only and it or products made from this pattern may not be used for resale may not be duplicated or reproduced without express permission from creatiknit@gmail com page 3 the santa cutie hat how to make a pom pom you will need 2 cardboard c s see printable template & instructions for both sizes on page 7 use color a 1 cut 2 or 3 diameter circles 2 line up cut outs & hold 3 working with 2 strands at 4 wrap strands around cut out of cardboard cut ¾ or 1¼ together the same time press & hold outs first around yarn ends diameter circles out of center them near cardboard opening to secure cut notch out of side to form a c 5 then continue wrapping 6 wrap till you get to the 7 wrap a 2nd time in the 8 cut working yarn strands around cut outs end of the c opposite direction till end 9 insert scissors between
